column4: is there a gui services editor in ubuntu (dont remember where i saw one.. mebbe suse/mandrake)? im just looking how to check what services run on startup
and another thing, can i configure gnome to react to search-by-typing? (for example in an icon list, when i press k it goes to the first icon beginning with k..)
it does automaticly jump to the first one with k, atleast in icons mode.
it does not react to any keys at least on my gnome..
it was always like that in gnome i think.. i just wondered if i can configure it otherwise..
ah, you want it to work in the filechooser?
I do not think GTK supports it yet.
and start typing the folder name.
but i hate the new filechooser
I love it, easier to browse different gnome-vfs controlled filesystems.
